sn5.7:4.2: Then the nun Upacālā got dressed in the morning …
sn5.7:4.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.7:4.4: The Māra the Wicked went up to Upacālā
sn5.7:4.6: “Nun, where do you want to be reborn?”
sn5.7:4.7: “I don’t want to be reborn anywhere, sir.”
sn5.7:5.1: “There’s the Gods of the Thirty-three, and those of Yama;
sn5.7:5.3: the Gods Who Love to Create,
sn5.7:5.4: and the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others.
sn5.7:5.5: Set your heart on such places,
sn5.7:6.1: “The Gods of the Thirty-three, and those of Yama;
sn5.7:6.3: the Gods Who Love to Create,
sn5.7:6.4: and the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others—
sn5.7:6.5: they’re bound with the bonds of sensuality;
sn5.7:6.6: they fall under your sway again.
sn5.7:7.1: All the world is on fire,
sn5.7:8.4: and not frequented by ordinary people.”
sn5.7:9.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Upacālā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
